website_summaries.verdict: Those looking to cut loose for a night will enjoy this somewhat crude adult party game.
pros: Game offers room for up to 5 players
Customers appreciate the game's hilarious drawings
A good choice for those seeking a humorous game with friends
cons: Cards could be thicker and more durable
Game is a little expensive for its low-quality build

customer_reviews.title: Just felt I should let folks know we were so disappointed after reading all the glowing reviews of this game
customer_reviews.text: This is the first review I've ever written despite being a heavy Amazon user. Just felt I should let folks know we were so disappointed after reading all the glowing reviews of this game. It is really, really boring. Nothing fun or funny about it. Played with age ranges 16-52. Stick to Cards Against Humanity or even Uno for a more entertaining card game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This game sucks ass. A Lousy hipster game trying to make ...
customer_reviews.text: This game sucks ass. A Lousy hipster game trying to make something out of nothi where there’s no real point in the whole game. And I am a lousy hipster. Not judging hipsters. Just the game. It sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie Holland

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize that this was an explicit version of the game. I have two teenagers and we have played this as a family. Although explicit, it wasn't "too" bad. If I had noticed, I probably would have ordered the original. For the most part, we weren't reading the details of the cards, we were concentrating on looking for matches. I wasn't offended by any of the cards personally. I would compare it to potty humor or what you might expect from a teenage boy. The game itself is fun to play. The instructions are easy enough to follow and understand.
customer_reviews.author: LVesper

customer_reviews.title: Most hilarious laughs we've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: This game is absolutely hilarious. If you want non-stop funbuy this game. We played it for hours and laughed the entire time there was some fun bantering as well. You see the game requires you to, make temporary alliances, screw everyone, or be sneaky, or a little of the above! The cards are hilarious. The picture are completely inappropriatly awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Don't waist your time
customer_reviews.text: Extreemly boring... Went off of good reviews... Other then some "adult" pictures with cats... It does not have a fast pace feel, or even a real point of the game. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RLAVA

customer_reviews.title: boring
customer_reviews.text: kind of boring... got rid of it in a white elephant gift exchange
customer_reviews.author: Mountain View Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Highly Addictive and Entertaining!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you love kittens, or really even if you don't love kittens you will love this game! I have bought myself this version and the original and all of my family members as well! Children and adults with love this suspenseful game. It is like a better and more anxiety ridden version of old maid...with a lot of twists! Can't explain how to play it, you just need to get it and try it out for yourself! I promise you will want to play it again and again and again! The game play goes quickly and most always everyone wants to play another round right after!
customer_reviews.author: Kali Cochran

customer_reviews.title: not funny. I think it would be better to play ...
customer_reviews.text: How this game has such high reviews is beyond me. It is a very basic game, not funny. I think it would be better to play with kids as it's easy to learn. Not a game I would play at an adult party. It gets boring very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: HRK

customer_reviews.title: Funny game for adult get-togethers
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my husband's favorite card games. We ordered the adult version which is extra hilarious. (Obviously NSFW or family-friendly.) This is a card based game which can be played with 2 to 4 players easily. It's mostly luck of the draw, like War but with inappropriate humor, and a little bit of strategy to it. For example, there cards that will allow you to look ahead to the next three cards. You decide what cards to play each turn. The game goes quickly and doesn't require a lot of effort, could easily be played even if you weren't sober ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Chaos, disorder, and laughter.
customer_reviews.text: Fun entertaining game where the point isn't to win, it's to not lose. Best played with people you are close enough to that you don't mind screwing them over in good fun (or with drunk people). We play this game at dinner parties at my house, and the drunker we get the more fun it is. Not a game for kids (probably not a good idea for young teens either, think of the lessons your teaching them).
customer_reviews.author: Henry W.

customer_reviews.title: Silly game
customer_reviews.text: Just not very enjoyable, even for the $15 sale price I grabbed it for. It's a humorous name, but actual gameplay is less entertaining than a game of Uno, which I'd say it's most similar to.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: This game looks fun, but the package didn't have all of the ...
customer_reviews.text: This game looks fun, but the package didn't have all of the cards in the instructions in it (no exploding kittens). It's two decks and both decks are identical - there are defuses and pairs, but no exploding kittens. It's not possible to play the game with the two decks in the NSFW edition! Are there suppose to be two different decks in the package maybe? Can't think of any reason why they'd sell it this way.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Warren

customer_reviews.title: Least fun card game ever?
customer_reviews.text: In the vein of games like Uno, but less fun and the words on the cards are teeny tiny so it slows down the unthrilling pace of the game even more. No idea why it's so popular
customer_reviews.author: Maegiulia

customer_reviews.title: Amusing Idea but Poor Implementation
customer_reviews.text: Probably the most dissapointing game I have played in a decade. Bought this to play with friends, for a good laugh, but after playing it with a few people for a few rounds, I can assure you that this game will not be played in our group again. The card illustrations and descriptions are amusing, but that's all that this game has going for it. It isn't even fun to play! I would much rather bring out the UNO deck than this card deck. I really wanted to like this game. Sadly, I cannot.
customer_reviews.author: DuchessJenn

customer_reviews.title: Too many instructions and rules
customer_reviews.text: The rules are confusing, and there are a lot of them. I wouldn't suggest playing this as a drinking game which is what it is marketed as. Definatley overrated, and even if I did take the time to figure it out it doesn't seem like it would be all that entertaining. It's not a game where you can kinda make up your own game rules and it's still hilarious. You continually have to reference the rules because every card does something different. I don't understand how this became so popular. I will most likely donate it next time I clean out the game closet.
customer_reviews.author: Traketawlker

customer_reviews.title: Fun new game, with strategy and luck involved, as well as psychology and game theory!
customer_reviews.text: Fun new game that's easy to learn and very portable! I would say it is a mix of strategy (~50%) and luck (~50%). Can play heads-up with as few as two people, or with up to five people. Can also purchase a second deck and play with 6-10 people. Have played with other couples before and "alliances" certainly form - in our game, each couple was secretly not screwing over their own significant other (e.g. stealing their cards, putting the exploding kitten where it would hurt them, etc), but this later turned into a guys vs. girls game because the girls were winning so often! Lots of psychology and game theory-type thinking keeps your mind actively thinking throughout.
customer_reviews.author: faridrunsTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Takes a min to master and best for 3-4 people but hilarious
customer_reviews.text: Love this game! Our friends are also fans of Cards Against Humanity so it's definitely good for that type of crowd. The cards are freaking hilarious, I legitimately LOL'd a few times. The instructions are a little complicated at first, but there is a video (link in the instructions) which makes a LOT more sense than trying to just read through the directions. We just watched the video, played a practice round, and then for round 2 we were all set and loved it! I would say if you're playing with 5-6 people the cards get spread a little thin so you might want to play with a smaller group of like 3-4 or get an expansion pack or something.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a white elephant gift exchange and was disappointed when no one was excited for it or stealing it. Fast forward to the next day and the person who got the gift had learned to play it the night they got it and brought it to family Christmas, where a bunch of us got in on it. That was the first time any of us had played it and it was a hit. Lots of fun, relatively quick game play, and even though there’s strategy involved there’s also a lot of luck so no one can be too good at it (like a word game).
customer_reviews.author: Diane A

customer_reviews.title: Card game sucks, blowing up kittens is cool though
customer_reviews.text: Skip the game, you will have more fun with a pocket full of M-80s and clearing out your local feral cat problem. Game is not hard to learn, but gets boaring quick. If your one of those PETA animal loving type that frown upon fireworks in a cats butt - i suggest getting Cards Against Humanity. Its much better game play and its only limits are how twisted and sick your circle of friends can be.
customer_reviews.author: Trikie_Dik

customer_reviews.title: One of the best adult party games
customer_reviews.text: I remember when someone first told me about this game, I was not even the slightest bit interested in playing, so I sat the first round out. I just sat there and sipped my beer in envy. This game turned out to be an incredibly fun game that I can compare to Card Against Humanity. Both are great for a chill adult get together with either close friends, but it’s great as a ice breaker for a group of new friends as well. Alcohol consumption is not needed, but makes for an elevated experience. Can’t wait to get all the expansions.
customer_reviews.author: Steph Pops

customer_reviews.title: Boring
customer_reviews.text: We played one round and nobody wanted to play it again. The cards are graphic and funny, that's about the extent of the game's appeal
customer_reviews.author: Kelly K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Enjoyable Card Game
customer_reviews.text: My family has been stuck inside our home during the pandemic so picking up a few extra games to keep everybody entertained has been one of my goals. This card games is easy to learn and play and is very enjoyable for a random number of players. This particular version is adult oriented so get one of the other versions if you have kids. It plays a little like UNO in that you sabotage each other, steal cards, and generally try to be the winner.
customer_reviews.author: FireVord

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Bigger Groups
customer_reviews.text: + Fun game with a big group (like 4-5 players). - It's fun for a while but doesn't hold up against time. The game doesn't last very long (I don't mean the individual games, I mean how long you can keep playing this game). The rules are too rigid for house rules to keep the game interesting. - Definitely not as fun in smaller groups.
customer_reviews.author: QP M

customer_reviews.title: Different????
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about this game, and I'm still on the fence about it. I figured it'd be a cute game to through into game night..... but it's different. Outside of oddball pictures, I don't know if there's any real appeal to this game. It's fast paced once you play a round and get the general idea of how to play, but after one game, that's kinda all you want to play. We've had more fun playing Deadpool vs the World, and it's a game the family will play continually because it's funny, but this one was just kinda ho-hum...
customer_reviews.author: cicisbo

customer_reviews.title: The ones that gave 4/5 stars must have played a dif. game
customer_reviews.text: I dont know what these people are talking about when they say "great game" "So much fun" this game makes so sense and it sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Catey C.

customer_reviews.title: I like this mostly because we can play with additional people
customer_reviews.text: I like this mostly because we can play with additional people, but I love looking through the new cards to see the pictures on them. The imploding kitten has seriously added a new element to the game as well, although if it happens really early on it can definitely be lame for that person, so we have occasionally played with the full deck minus the imploding kitten card. The new cards are shuffled into the existing deck and just stored in that box, so if we bring the game somewhere we typically don't bring the cone of shame. So unfortunately we haven't actually used it yet. I'm really looking forward to that time though!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn game good for some fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for a White Elephant party this Christmas and actually ended up bringing it home myself. The cards are colorful and funny (though definitely NSFW as advertised) and it's very easy to learn. It took my girlfriend and I about 5 minutes to learn how to play for our first game then about 10 minutes to play. It's decently fun with a bit of strategy but I wouldn't say it's the most fun game in the world. Once you play multiple rounds in a row it starts becoming repetitive. But I'd say it's worth picking up for devoted board gamers to add to your group as a game that can be played really quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ben BalesTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Great game! Bring on the expansions!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this game as a Christmas present for my brother in law, and we have played it at almost every family function since! There is a bit of a learning curve and it can be a little confusing at first, but the hilarity of it is really amazing. I like that the NSFW version can be mixed with the regular version to have more payment opportunities, but would love to see the company do some expansions similar to Cards Against Humanities to keep it from becoming boring when played by the same people all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Cassizzle25

customer_reviews.title: All I can say...
customer_reviews.text: Its a funny game, my wife and I played it the moment we got it out of the box. :) Took a whole 2 minutes to read the manual(It was a threat in of itself) and we were off to the races...well explosions. Cards are of good quality. One thing to take into consideration is make sure that if you are gifting this... the person at the other end has a good sense of humor, I learned it's not for every "adult"! Wife and I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: NOPE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! I was hoping this would be a new form of CAH, but it most certainly is not
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Clever, fast, and two people can play.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the NSFW edition, although I already knew about the PG edition. My comments apply to either version. It is a lot of fun, and easy to learn. However the NSFW version has a lot of scatological and sexual stuff. Upsides: The game uses only cards, like Uno. It is small, fast, and portable. Two people can play it (even while traveling by bus, train, or airplane). There are no counters or tokens or board layouts. Downsides: It is an elimination game (like the Risk board game). The last surviving player wins after the others are exploded by the kittens... so the losers might be bored. Note: No actual kittens are exploded in this game.
customer_reviews.author: Craig K. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: The NSFW really isn't too bad at all
customer_reviews.text: The game is addicting. The NSFW really isn't too bad at all. Honestly after the first time playing it, you wont really even look at the card sayings. Strategy is the key for this game. We have made our own rules for when we want to "drink" and play the game. This game is better played with at least 3 people or more. Plan on buying another set to make it more interesting and for more people. The price point is too High in my opinion. you are getting a deck of cards, period.
customer_reviews.author: DTTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Fun game to play
customer_reviews.text: Watched a few YouTubes to understand it. Played 4 people for hours. It was really fun! The game takes strategy. We all would play again and it was a fun game to pass some time while hanging out with friends. Highly recommend. The cards aren’t anything crazy- nothing as obscene as some games out there. Mild adult humor.
customer_reviews.author: AZShopper

customer_reviews.title: ... is a very fasted paced game and so much fun! We were stuck in a hotel room in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fasted paced game and so much fun! We were stuck in a hotel room in the rain while at an amusement park, and thankfully I had brought Exploding Kittens along just in case! What a great game! It made the time pass so fast while we waited out the rain! Pros - Fast Paced, Funny Cards, Easy to learn Cons - Sometimes it feels like we need more cards I would suggest this game to anyone who enjoys a fast passed card game!
customer_reviews.author: SnowDogs

customer_reviews.title: Explosion of laughs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game. The cards are hilarious, and this makes for an easy game to pull out for a quick few games with guests. The material is definitely on the Not Safe For Work side, and the game play is easy enough to understand very quickly, so no fumbling through pages and pages of directions. As a gaming fan, it doesn't stand up to many other games because it is fairly simple, and half the fun is in discovering the hilarious cards (but you see about all the cards after a few game plays). Definitely a great game to have in your back pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Loucks

customer_reviews.title: it's a fun game and doesn't hurt your friendship (hopefully)
customer_reviews.text: Hours of entertainment. I got the family edition as a christmas gift and decided to purchase the NSFW edition along with the expansion. In my honest opinion, you dont really need the NSFW edition, after first playing the game with reading the description, my friends and I stopped and just said the action. Either way, it's a fun game and doesn't hurt your friendship (hopefully)
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy T

customer_reviews.title: Ok so the game play is fun, not real addicting but fun
customer_reviews.text: Ok so the game play is fun, not real addicting but fun. The nsfw version is hardly explicit at all i mean after a while you dont even really read the cards you just know you need defuse cards and avoid the exploding kittens. But the downside is the quality of the cards, very poor quality put into the one and only thing you use.....CARDS! After 2 or 3 games we had the exploding kitten cards start to come apart at the corners, unacceptable!!! and we were very gentle with shuffling and gameplay. Fun game, poor product!!
customer_reviews.author: Thunderxgb

customer_reviews.title: Just boring and confusing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a couple who has the original version and played it at an adult game night. While the couple it was purchased for did enjoy playing it all the other couples, including myself, found it very confusing and not really funny at all. The cards do have off colored jokes and sayings on them but there is no part of the game where it is required to read them so I saw no point. The couple it was purchased for said that it does get more fun as you become more familiar with the rules but we only played one hand and no one was disappointed to move on to another game.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey B

customer_reviews.title: Vey funny and inappropriate too
customer_reviews.text: Vey funny and inappropriate too! lol I bought from my husband for Christmas and we both have gotten a kick out of playing it at night after the kids go to bed. NOT a family version of this game at all. It's good for a chuckle when you want to do something together besides just stare at the TV. Easy to understand after a few minutes and games don't last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Leah P

customer_reviews.title: Seek another option. .
customer_reviews.text: After playing cards against humanity and loving it we thought we'd give this a try. I hate to say it but I don't get the hype. And trust me I have an excellent sense of humor. The game goes quick but I found the cards really hard to read. The print is super small. I like that it is portable and on its own case bug the instructions were poorly written and having to watch a video was a little time consuming. Probably would not recommend this. There are more fun options out there. Really not worth the price
customer_reviews.author: A. Benson

customer_reviews.title: If you thought the original version was twisted...
customer_reviews.text: Do not have food or drink around when you play this or you WILL choke! In this version you can base jump with old lady boob wings or tie a butterfly to your genitals and "see where life takes you". If you think the mental image of that is disturbing, wait until you see the illustrations! You will have so much fun playing this while you laugh out loud leaving the rest of the players wondering what in the world you have in your hand. The makers got it right with the age recommendation of "30 and up?". They may recommend that but it is much more fun to let your inner 12 year old play on your behalf.
customer_reviews.author: Abnmech

customer_reviews.title: Just so so
customer_reviews.text: Honestly it gave us chuckles the first time round, but after that it kind of loses it's humor. The cards are more funny because of their illustrations. A bit of a disappointment since the reviews are so great. It's not a bad game at all but we need a little more challenge to a game or a lot more variety to keep us into it. The box and cards were in great condition though.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff Thomas

customer_reviews.title: NSFW Edition is great for adults!! Avoid it for children because of content! ... Cards can easily tear so take good care of them
customer_reviews.text: It is indeed an very fun game to play with friends! It is usually no longer than 15 minutes to end a match and the strategy will be for sure always different. NSFW edition is great for adults, you can laugh a lot on the first time a new player sees the card's images :D The main issue with this set is the cards been so fragile, the will get tear easily if not used with care (And considering this a table game, then tear will get for sure)
customer_reviews.author: Luis Ramirez Castro

customer_reviews.title: A fun game with limited replay value.
customer_reviews.text: The game is very simple, it's basically Old Maid. It plays in about 15min. The cards are great, but this deck is really all about the shock value of the titles and images. Once you go through all the cards, it drastically loses it's replay value. It's not a "deep" game, by any means so there's very little strategy involved. I would recommend it as a way to break-the-ice and make people laugh, but keep in mind it's not appropriate for kids under the age of 15. Or people without a sense of humor.
customer_reviews.author: MaxwellTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Our friends never come visit us because the are lazy jerks so we love two player games!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the game. It is difficult to find games that are new and exciting and are playable with only two people and HOORAY! for Exploding Kittens! Yes, we've had the same issue with the tiny tears in the edges of the cards so you just have to be more creative on how you play and how you hide things in your hand and you have to continually shuffle what's in your hand. I think it adds to the tension - at least with the two of us.
customer_reviews.author: Majombaszo

customer_reviews.title: This Game is Boring
customer_reviews.text: The fun wore off on this game after 2 times. I wouldn’t waste your money. The cards are funny but the game itself is not that entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most AMAZING game!!! Buy this NOW!
customer_reviews.text: This game is AMAZING! If you've played Cards Against Humanity, the NSFW edition really won't shock you at all since it's WAY tamer than that game! I've played this a bunch of times now, the rules are easy but there are a few parts to it that make it a little competive and is so fun! Such a simple concept that keeps everyone engaged because turns are fairly quick. I would recommend this to anyone who likes a fun card game that doesn't have the pressure of taking your entire night to play it. I really need to buy another deck because there's been a few occasions now where we have 6 people and 1 person had to sit out.
customer_reviews.author: A. Berube

customer_reviews.title: Very fun. Exactly what I'd expect from The Oatmeal as ...
customer_reviews.text: Very fun. Exactly what I'd expect from The Oatmeal as far as the text and the drawings. A word of warning, the rules are not very well written though and can be interpreted multiple ways which can be frustrating for people who are competitive. So if you're easily offended or overly competitive maybe this game is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica A.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and hilarious
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a white elephant gift instead of Cards Against Humanity, mostly because we have several friends and family that already own that game and this seemed not as well known. Well, it was a hit! We played it immediately after finishing our white elephant game and had such a blast. I like that the game doesn't last very long, so it's easy to rotate players if you have a large group. But at the same time it would be nice if this could accommodate more players, although I suppose that can be solved by having multiple decks. I may have to purchase another set so that I have my own.
customer_reviews.author: licketysplit

customer_reviews.title: How could the Exploding of Kittens be a desirable thing...?
customer_reviews.text: I consider my life enriched having learned about this game during its Kickstarter campaign. I had not heard of Elan Lee or Matthew Inman prior, but am now a fan that enjoys turning others onto the humor and card game that they have crafted. I love the expansions... the app... I had no idea how much color Exploding Kittens were capable of adding to my experience here on Earth. If you haven't tried it, you probably should. Now!
customer_reviews.author: Monkeybrew

customer_reviews.title: Exploding Kittens NSFW version is really fun to have in your game arsenal
customer_reviews.text: Exploding Kittens NSFW version is really fun to have in your game arsenal. It doesn't take long to learn and its quite enjoyable. My and my friend play this at least once a week when we get together for game night. I like the graphics that are on the cards. This is my first first purchase of exploding kittnes NSFW. I have never tried the first version but I assume the first one is also as enjoyable. I would recommend this to anyone who has a dark sense of humor and generally likes things that are way out there but also loves card games.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: which you dont get a game like this if your not planning on it
customer_reviews.text: When they say that it takes 5 minutes to learn and 15 to play, they werent kidding. Me and my wife decided to play this with a friend the first time and it took us a couple of minutes to figure it out. I decided to play it with another friend and just explained things as we went and he got it without a issue. Beyond that, the game can be as complicated as you want it to be, given that your okay with being a total jerk to your friends to win, which you dont get a game like this if your not planning on it.
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Cousins and relatives loved it, but several of my gamer friends got bored of it fast. So my cousins loved playing it over christmas and their ages ranged from 16-22. However, my friends 26-31 got bored of it after 1-2 games. A few of them didn't like it because there wasn't much diversity in the cards. Some thought the NSFW edition was meh, and needed to be more extreme. Then everyone else got bored because after playing a few games, you find the "meta" or main "strategy" that everyone does the same thing over and over.Overall i thought it was okay. Had several great games, and entertained my cousins over christmas
customer_reviews.author: John Cao

customer_reviews.title: I Can Not Stop Playing!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be a super simple quick game at first... And it can be, but once you start playing it turns into something else completely. you can involve SO MUCH strategy! you can bluff, and you can get to a point where you're actually good at it, and not just lucky, like with a lot of fun games like this. So in other words, you can play sober, and have fun for hours! Its literally addicting, we cant stop playing it when we start! Or you can play drunk, laugh your ass off at the hilarious cards, and still have fun for hours! If you're thinking about buying this, don't think, just buy. You'll thank me!
customer_reviews.author: chad keller

customer_reviews.title: Interesting game, hilarious cards
customer_reviews.text: I received this package on time, came two days after ordering. The box was much smaller than I expected but it came with all 56 cards. The cards are flimsy and thin but the game itself is great. The thought process behind the game is awesome, and the cards themselves are hilarious. I've never seen a card game quite like this one, I can't wait to play it with my friends to see what they think! I would recommend buying an expansion pack with the game since the pack was smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella Worcester

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this games based on Amazon reviews and we were looking for a new game to try after endless games of cards against humanity. This had a small learning curve, but once we got the hang of it, it was awesome fun!! The games are fairly quick which is nice, as you do not need to invest long stretches of time. Well worth the purchase !!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious and fun game
customer_reviews.text: This game is so fun. I own both versions and the expansion pack. You can play with all of them to extend the game or to add more players. This one is not for kids though. Buy the original al for the kid friendly version. This game will get everyone laughing and all of the cards are very amusing. It's easy to learn and fast so you don't get bored.
customer_reviews.author: JandMB2212

customer_reviews.title: This game is awesome. It says it is easy and fast to ...
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome. It says it is easy and fast to learn, and it is so true. It's such a quick game, too. Whether you have a couple minutes to kill, or want to play several rounds, my longest single round was 15 minutes. The art is perfect, especially if you are a fan of The Oatmeal. The cards are high quality. The mechanics are simple. There is zero ambiguity to the rules. Overall, very worth it. Strategy, luck, fun are the only things necessary.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. Hochschild

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn and fun to play
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the easier games to explain to friends and pick up when you need to blow some time. Easy to play for 15 minutes or 2 hours. This one is obviously for adults only and I would say go ahead and get it if you aren't playing with kids.
customer_reviews.author: VisibleKitten

customer_reviews.title: Not bad quick to learn but these reviews are a little high IMHO
customer_reviews.text: Fun easy quick game. Its good for 15 minutes. Around 20 minutes into it you get bored. Seems suspiciously highly rated. Its more of a $10 game than $20 and the box is kind of large. But a fun game to keep around the house for adults and kids.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Hanson

customer_reviews.title: people were crying...tears of laughter.
customer_reviews.text: This game is a lot of fun! Myself and my girlfriend first played it with just the two of us and not knowing how to play it, we still had fun. We learned as we played along and read the rules which were very simple and easy to understand. The packaging is neat and all very fun. We’ve since played it with friends and family a few times...and it’s been a hoot! Everyone loves it (C.O.A. – remember this version is strictly for adults). This game is particularly fun because again, its easy to set up, explain to others and fun to play. Fun game to play during holiday gatherings, game night...etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jakub_K

customer_reviews.title: and a lot of fun! Warning
customer_reviews.text: This game is hilarious, and a lot of fun! Warning: It does take a bunch of reading to understand the game play, and then it seems to start off pretty slow, but don't let that dissuade you. Keep playing. (And if you introduce new people to the game, just jump right in and teach them as you go rather than trying to explain all the rules first.) It gets pretty strategic toward the end, and reading the cards in the meantime will keep your humor up.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna B

customer_reviews.title: Freakishly fun game
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome. Very fun to play. I was however put off by the size of the box. I thought there was more to it then just cards. But after playing the game it is worth it. Maybe a little pricy for just cards though. The instructions are easy to understand and the game goes pretty fast. So it is not like monopoly where it drags on and on. I bought this as a Christmas present for my brother and he takes it everywhere now. The box is very durable and pretty easy to carry with you where ever you go.
customer_reviews.author: Esouth

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious
customer_reviews.text: While the kids are off playing the regular edition, my wife and I are battling it out trying with this one. Exactly like the standard version when it comes to gameplay. Only difference is the art which is alittle more dirty but none the less just a hilarious. Game has the concept of Russian roulette but with kittens instead. Much fun!
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Buy This Game!!
customer_reviews.text: This game has replaced Cards Against Humanity as my family get together "go to" game. So much fun. I don't think I have ever laughed so hard playing a card game. I have already purchased the expansion pack because I know this will be a game we play a lot! definitely worth the $16.00 I spent.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious!
customer_reviews.text: I played this game at one of my friends' place and bought this the very next day. This game is so much fun! I love it. It is perfect for when my boyfriend and I invite over some friends and we have a few drinks. The concept is fairly simple yet complicated enough to keep you thinking. The super weird cards are always sure to get a few laughs as well. I definitely recommend it. I would not play this game with my parents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I hate myself for loving this game
customer_reviews.text: I hate myself for loving this game. I also hate my nephew, my friends, pretty much anyone that Ive played this game with. Just when I think I may win, the stupid exploding kitten card comes out and boom, I'm dead and I don't have anymore defusing cards. You're gonna love this game, just be prepared to break friendships over it, imagine Monopoly on crack...yeah. Now go order this game.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Explicit content!! Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: So fun but beware explicit content!! My husband helped my daughter shop for Christmas and they did not read carefully and accedently ordered this one instead of the more age appropriate one for our kids. We were so excited to play only realizing it after a round or two it was not just crude but oh no cover the kids eyes !! LOL OOPS PARENT FAIL. We will keep this one for grown up game night and ordered the kid friendly one.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca H.

customer_reviews.title: Funny game.  Love the Oatmeal
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun and creative. I have been a super fan of "The Oatmeal" for as long as I can remember, and this game does not disappoint. It's great for just my husband and I, or with a few of our friends while we have a bottle share. I am glad that we got the adult version, as I feel like it makes it more interesting, especially with us being... ya know, adults and all. A few swear words never hurt anyone. This is definitely a game you need if you're looking to amp up your game closet. C'Mon, you know you want to try it.
customer_reviews.author: It's Erika, Yo!

customer_reviews.title: Fun game and friends loved it as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: Have the original and we loved the game so much I bought this version to gift it to a friend who also loves and enjoys the game. Only issue is that because this game was played mostly during parties, these cards don't hold up as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Li

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: One of the most fun games we found in a long time. If you have more than 5 friends playing, you need to buy two decks, but it is worth it. Our teen son has the regular version. We enjoyed it so much we bought the NSFW edition for the parents. It is not really THAT inappropriate, this version just has a few minor sexual references and some obscenities thrown in for good measure. Cute artwork from The Oatmeal :)
customer_reviews.author: A. Converse

customer_reviews.title: Same game with explicit content
customer_reviews.text: Exploding Kittens' older sibling. If you already bought the original edition, I recommend that you buy this with it if you are a responsible and mature (maybe) adult. As the title suggests, the art is very questionable for the workplace so definitely don't play this with kids. I used this in addition to my regular deck as a special surprise for a party I went to. I think everyone appreciated the art. Above all else, gameplay is amazing. Paranoia and sabotage and hilarity. You can't beat a card game that fulfills all three.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: ESSENTIAL
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend for kids... but I LOVE this game. The cards are entertaining and the expansion packs that you can also buy make it really interesting. I love games that you can add more to... It’s like an inappropriate version of UNO but better!!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Fun game. Makes a great gift.
customer_reviews.text: I won't elaborate on game play dynamics because I think others have done that. But this is a very fun, simply game. I have purchased and played both editions and prefer the standard edition because once you've seen the funny NSFW cards a couple of times, you stop pointing them out and just refer to their type "Skip, Attack, Nope, etc." I think it plays best with 4 or 5 players. Its more interactive and there are more exploding kitten cards in play compared to a 2 or 3 player game.
customer_reviews.author: C Ski

customer_reviews.title: The Original With a Twist
customer_reviews.text: Like the original, this one plays just the same. The illustrations and descriptions are just dirtier, but it's not any more difficult to learn. This plays in about the same length of time as the original, making it a good choice if you still want the same level of challenge with a little dirtier content.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Rushton-Southers

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this stupid %#$&ing game. It is not fun or interesting. I suppose the profanity has some shock value if you have never heard sweats before? But it’s not good. Just play cards against humanity or something way better.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with newer expansions, different card backs, and now loot bags...
customer_reviews.text: Incompatible with newer expansions, different card backs, and now loot bags...
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Truly not that different than regular exploding kittens
customer_reviews.text: Sold as for ages 30 and above I would have thought the game play a bit more complex and the graphics a bit more risque. If you have kids, or ever play around them opt for the the less explicit Exploding Kittens. Bought both and was disappointed with how similar they were.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: Cards started peeling during the first game...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty fun game (not with only two players though. Way too easy to mess with your opponent) but as other reviewers have mentioned, extremely fragile cards. The backing of the cards comes off so easy. Played it once and the cards are already peeling so now we know what some of the cards are! Extremely poor quality. If you want a game that you want to play more than a handful of times, find something else. Honestly, not worth the $15.
customer_reviews.author: Brett S.

customer_reviews.title: Great game -- Gave it a 4 star review because the instructions SUCK. LOL
customer_reviews.text: The instructions somewhat suck, but the game is fun once you get it figured out. It's sort of like a cross between Old Maid and Go Fish...only with obscene artwork. Beautifully obscene artwork. Buy it. Just realize that the first time you play it, you'll do it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Black

customer_reviews.title: Card quality is cheap..
customer_reviews.text: I like the game, its easy and quick to play with my wife. But the cards are cheap.. be careful shuffling because you could easily damage a corner or the sides. I cheated once when there was a damaged exploding kitten, and I could tell where it was throughout the game. Ended up getting rid of it because it ruined the fun. Also, the NSFW pack isn't really all that.. you're better off buying the original in my opinion. Plus are arent really "Not Safe For Work", you can bring this to work and I guarentee you wont get in trouble.. it should be labeled "Not Safe For Elementary School".
customer_reviews.author: Kayla washburn

customer_reviews.title: Fun game! Even for 2 people
customer_reviews.text: Love this game! I have the original as well, very easy to learn and fun to play, even with just 2 people, definitely reccomend for for a fun/easy adult game(all ages for the original one) blends in great with the original game to play with more then 5 players
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what to expect, but my girlfriend and I love this game. The cards are hilarious and the game play is really fun! I only wish they would come out with a NSFW expansion. 100% worth the money, as long as you don't get offended by genitals....NSFW = Not Safe For Work.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Alcock

customer_reviews.title: Not funny, just dumb.
customer_reviews.text: I love the exploding kittens game. And I promise I’m not a prude AT ALL. We play cards against humanity on the regular. So I expected that NSFW might be a fun twist. It’s not. It just seems like they are trying so hard to be perverse that it is creepy, not funny. Don’t waste your money. Get the regular exploding kittens instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game several years ago and I play it every chance I get! It’s such a fun game and super easy to learn! It’s still in very good condition even after all the use it has received! This would be a perfect gift as well
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Not much to see here, fuzzy rules
customer_reviews.text: Meh. This had great reviews, and was marketed as "the fastest funded game in Kickstarter history", or something like that. The game just wasn't that fun. The rules are a little confusing, so we kinda just adjusted them to suit ourselves when we played. I could see the Safe For Work being more fun for kids, but for adults, just didn't do anything for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sluchini

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: To answer any questions, this is NOT an add on pack to the game. This is the base game, just with some NSFW cards thrown in. The cards are absolutely hilarious though, we had a fun time playing!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany L Porter

customer_reviews.title: Fun at first...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game, but only for a few play-throughs. What makes it the most fun is the artwork on the cards. Some of the cards are hilarious (especially the NSFW edition). But after you've seen all the cards the actual game-play is marginal. Also the cards are very fragile and gets nicks very easily, which if it happens to one of the "exploding kittens" can make the game downright impossible to play. However this takes about 5-7 hands to become a problem (like I said VERY fragile) and by then you should be bored with the game anyway.
customer_reviews.author: S. Green

customer_reviews.title: OMG this game is amazing! I love how fast paced it is and ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG this game is amazing! I love how fast paced it is and how quick and easy it is to learn. I also enjoy the illustrations on each card, they are great and funny and add to the game as well. I recommend getting this game and playing it even it if it just 2 people playing, it is a lot of fun with many people too. If you enjoy fast paced games and the fun of not knowing if you will be out on your next turn or not, or even turning on your friends, then get this game.
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: This is game is SO fun! Some games are quick and some last till ...
customer_reviews.text: This is game is SO fun! Some games are quick and some last till the last cards, but it is a great time nonetheless. Can easily be made into a drinking game as well...if you're into that sort of thing. All my friends have loved it so far, and I purchased the expansion pack shortly after purchasing this. I have played with 2 and 4 players, and it was fun even with one other person.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Richerson

customer_reviews.title: Funny and fun
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. It's so raunchy and it's easy to learn. We play this all the time. Definitely not kid-friendly. Made my mother in law blush and say "OH MY GOODNESS". We laughed at her reaction and kept playing.
customer_reviews.author: AlliCat0420

customer_reviews.title: I want to rebuy for myself!
customer_reviews.text: Great game! I was unsure at first if this would be a fun game but wow I am surprised! Gave as a Christmas gift to my fiancé’s brother and it had us all laughing, scheming, and escaping exploding kittens for over an hour! Each game got more entertaining as we learned how to play. I might repurchase to have a copy of this game in my house!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game, Good for Younger Audience
customer_reviews.text: I liked Apples to Apples and Cards Against Humanity. This game is not on their same 5-Star rating for me. 4 Stars, there's probably a crowd (younger) who would enjoy this game more than I.
customer_reviews.author: johnnysausages

customer_reviews.title: Tremendously fun game. Fast paced play
customer_reviews.text: Tremendously fun game. Fast paced play, easy to figure out strategy, and leads to some downright ruthless behavior. Artwork is funny, though it makes an otherwise family safe game completely inappropriate for kids. It does say basically that in the title though. Definitely happy with my purchase, though slightly disappointed that I gave it as a gift, because I'm going to want this when we have friends over. You'll need more than one deck if you want to play with more than 5 people.
customer_reviews.author: Luke M. Frank

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game mainly for mini get togethers. I was amused with the same, but is really dependent on who you play with. The cartoons are explicit as stated in the title NSFW, but I like it since it adds a bit of excitement when you first start playing (I have never seen the safe for work version). Pro - Great ice breaker - Cartoon are interestingly drawn - Great if you want something quick - once you reach the bottom of the deck, it is done Cons This game can get dull after since you can play it quickly
customer_reviews.author: Kevin V

customer_reviews.title: Fun, quick, hilarious.
customer_reviews.text: The NSFW version is especially fun! I had the original but when I lost it, I decided to get this one instead and I end up spending maybe too much time inspecting and reading the card when it's my turn. The artwork is awesome and unique. This is a really fun, easy, quick game. The more the merrier, but it works just fine with 3+ people.
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: Cute and easy
customer_reviews.text: Fun game to play with the kids. It's not a very in depth or consuming game, but nice to kill some time. Easy to learn. I bought the NSFW edition and didn't find it bad at all. As I said I play it with the kids in my life. (11-14) I would recommend looking through the cards first though.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Group Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Super fun game with a group of friends! Easy to learn and super bizarre. Definitely one to have in your game collection! Easy to learn 5/5 ***** Card Quality 5/5 ***** Fun Factor 5/5 ***** My Recommendation 5/5 *****
customer_reviews.author: Vuong Ly

customer_reviews.title: Laughed until our sides hurt!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! We played this at a holiday party after the kids went to bed. Everyone had a great time - lots of laughter! The cards have responses that are so very not politically correct, if you don't enjoy that type of humour - do not purchase this! Adult humour - adult content DO NOT PLAY AROUND YOUNG CHILDREN!!! Fantastic game for adults who want to laugh until their sides hurt
customer_reviews.author: Anne-marie

customer_reviews.title: Funny and entertaining
customer_reviews.text: Great game to gift to friends or keep for yourself. Definitely not a kids game unless your good with some weird looking pic of kittens. I knew what to expect so it wasn't a surprise. Eady game to play with everyone.
customer_reviews.author: arthur

product_meta.title: Exploding Kittens Card Game - Nsfw (Explicit Adult Content) Edition - Family-Friendly Party Games - Card Games for Adults, Teens and Kids
product_meta.description: Style:Exploding Kittens NSFW (ADULT Content)Exploding kittens is a card game for people who are into kittens and explosions and laser beams and sometimes goats. In this highly-strategic, kitty-powered version of Russian roulette, players draw cards until someone draws an exploding kitten, at which point They explode, they are Dead, and they are out of the game -- unless that player has a defuse card, which can defuse the kitten using things like laser pointers, belly rubs, and catnip sandwiches. All of the other cards in the deck are used to move, mitigate, or avoid the exploding kittens. This nsfw version of the game contains the full version of exploding kittens, but the artwork on each card has been replaced with content too horrible/amazing to be used in the original exploding kittens game. The nsfw edition can be played with 2 to 5 players or combined with another deck to play with up to 9 players.
feature_bullets: More than 9 million copies sold, breaking records in kids games, adult games and everything in-between
A highly strategic, kitty-powered version of Russian roulette, basically, if you draw an exploding kitten, you lose and you are full of loser sad-sauce
This “game of the year” award winner is the perfect holiday gift if you’re looking for board games for adults but want to be able to play fun games with your kids as well
It's like uno, except there are goats, magical enchiladas and kittens that can kill you, -cnn
This holiday gift favorite takes 5 minutes to learn, 15 minutes to play, is for 2-5 players (ages 7+) and includes 56 cards, box and instructions
Same exploding kittens madness, but with card art much too horrible/incredible to include in a kid-friendly version, do not buy for children, unless you're ready to have some weird conversations

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars8,754 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
